X.T: Untangle URIs, URLs, and URNs
X.ST: Naming and the problem of persistence

ARTICLE.COMMENT: What are the differences between a URI, a URL and a URN? The answer provided here is not so clear.

X.T: What Is Web 2.0
X.ST: Design Patterns and Business Models for the Next Generation of Software

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The new trends of the Internet, which are referred as Web2.0: the Web is the platform, using the users to build value, the data is the value, continuous software upgrade, lightweight programming models, target any device (non only the PC) and rich GUIs.

X.T: Technologies to Watch: A Look at Four That May Challenge Javaâ€™s Development Dominance

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some new technologies (dynamic languages, frameworks supporting continuation, data links defined by convention instead of configuration and metaprogramming) may displace Java from the leader place in Web programming. But it is difficult to find the future next hip technologyâ€¦

X.T: Discover Internet Protocol, version 6 (IPv6)
X.ST: Learn about the concepts, benefits, and industry compliance of this next-generation protocol

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A short description of the IPv6 address syntax and a list of products supporting IPv6.

X.T: See where the Internet lives

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of Equinix data warehouse.

X.T: Web Applications & the Desktop's Future
X.ST: Today's technology narrows the gap between Web and desktop applications, transforming the user experience.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A description of the evolution of Web applications, there is nothing new in this article.

X.T: Kevin Kelly: The next 5,000 days of the web
The next 5,000 days of the web

ARTICLE.COMMENT: KevinKelly describes his vision of Internet future: this one is very similar to common ideas about the subject (everything will be connected to the Internet, the semantic Webâ€¦).

X.T: Supporting Casual Data-Centric Interactions on the Web

ARTICLE.COMMENT: David Huynh presents several of his projects aimed at enabling non-programmers to publish and to retrieve structured data from the Web: Exhibit, Piggy Bank, Sifter, Potluckâ€¦

X.T: Information Seeking, Visualization, and Decision-Making

ARTICLE.COMMENT: This talk about delivering the "right information to the right people in the right time" is much too abstract, there is no valuable information here.

X.T: HOP: A Language for Programming the Web 2.0

ARTICLE.COMMENT:
Yet another language to write applications running across the Web (computer, phone, HIFIâ€¦). The slides are unreadable, but they are accessible at http://hop.inria.fr/talks/hopdiffuse.xhtml.gzhttp://hop.inria.fr/talks/hopdiffuse.xhtml.gz
enHTML.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: JoelSpolsky is presenting his site: available features, used technologies, user base growthâ€¦

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A technical presentation of an iPhone application handling geolocated messages of NIN fans.

X.T: Whats eating Scientific Data? 21st Century Approaches to Discovering (Chemical) Data

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The application of some semantic Web technologies to chemistry.

X.T: Beyond Web 2.0 -- How RDFa Can Help to Democratise Data on the Web

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some use examples of RDFa: vertical search engines, richer customisable UIâ€¦

X.T: URL shortening is hot--but look before you leap
X.ST: Fueled by Twitter's popularity, services to abbreviate Web addresses are taking off. They bring a host of problems, but some are working to fix them.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: With Twitter popularity, more and more URL shortener sites are created. URL shortening has some interesting side effects and also some drawbacks.

X.T: Persona Editor

ARTICLE.COMMENT: MarcCanter presents his idea of a tool, using an outline representation, to manage data across several sites.

X.T: Video: Delete Flash cookies to protect online privacy

ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to manage Flash cookies using the Adobe Flash Player Settings Manager.

X.T: 402 Payment Required

ARTICLE.COMMENT: After a presentation of the economics of the Web, Daniel A. Nagy presents a prototype he created: a Firefox extension managing micropayments.

X.T: An overview of the Chrome Web Store Licensing API

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The title says it all.

X.T: Introducing HTML5 video
X.ST: Why we need HTML5 video and how to use it

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A history of the video on the Web and the current status with HTML 5 and its different formats and codecs.

X.T: YUI Theater â€” Allen Rabinovich: "The Many Hats of the Frontend Engineers" (37 min.)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Allen suggests that a front-engineer should be at the same time an engineer, an anthropologist, a writer, an artist, a paranoid, and a futurist.

X.T: Look ahead to emerging web technologies in 2011
X.ST: 20 years after its inception, the web is still developing

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A prediction of 2011 trends: cloud computing, two-ways communication between the server and the Browser, cross-platform development tool, CoffeeScript, geolocalisation, data synchronisation across devices, and user interface.

X.T: To Harness The Long Tail Online, Location Does Matter As Does Time

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some statistical analysis (whose curves seem to me to be too beautiful to be true) shows that the repartition of visited sites depends on the location and on the week day. The presenter claims that this can be used to model the long tail, but his studies seem to be far from reaching this goal.

X.T: Move Over Google Analytics, Here Comes Woopra!

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The author advises to use Woopra because of its real time reporting.

X.T: Scott Schiller: Web Audio - HTML5 + Flash (in a tree)

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Using IBM Process Design, IBM Process Server and Dojo to model and implement a business process.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A good and short explanation on how to properly exploit the Browser cache.

X.T: High Performance Web Sites and YSlow

ARTICLE.COMMENT:
SteveSouders describes the importance of the front-end in the performance, the fact that data is most often not cachedâ€¦ Then, he details some of his 14 rules:
Make fewer HTTP requests
Use a CDN
Add an Expires header
Gzip components
Put stylesheets at the top
Move scripts at the bottom
Make JS and CSS external
Minify JS
Avoid redirects
Make AJAX cacheableAt last, he speaks about his tool to check if these rules are respected: YSlow.

X.T: YDN Theater â€” Julien Lecomte: "High Performance Ajax Applications"

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Some advice on how to write fast AJAX.

ARTICLE.COMMENT: A presentation of Episodes.

X.T: Non-blocking JavaScript Downloads

ARTICLE.COMMENT: Several workarounds to avoid the fact that Browsers download, parse and execute each script before downloading the other components.

X.T: Faster HTML and CSS: Layout Engine Internals for Web Developers

ARTICLE.COMMENT: DavidBaron explains some internals of Firefox that should be taken into account to improve page and script performance.

X.T: YUI Theater â€” Douglas Crockford: "Ajax Performance"

ARTICLE.COMMENT: The advices given by DouglasCrockford are basic performance good practices, but his description of applying these to Ajax is clear and effective.

X.T: YUI Theater â€” Nicole Sullivan: "Design Fast Websites (Don't Blame the Rounded Corners)"

ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to design a fast site: create a component library, avoid using too many styles, crush images, avoid non-standard browser fontsâ€¦

X.T: Life's Too Short - Write Fast Code (part 2)

ARTICLE.COMMENT:
Some new rules
Load scripts without blocking
Couple asynchronous scripts
Flush the document early
Use iframes sparinglySouders focuses on the two first bullets, describing several solutions with their pros & cons, since none of them is the best for all situations.

A presentation of some well-known performance subjects:
- How to limit the slowness of interacting with the DOM
- How to have a responsive interface

- Combining, minifying, compressing, proper management of the Browser cache, using a CDN
- Network analysers and profilers.
